member.name: T:Accord.Extensions.Statistics.Filters.KalmanFilterExtensions
member.summary: Extension methods for the Kalman filter.

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Statistics.Filters.KalmanFilterExtensions.CalculateDistanceMatrix``3(System.Collections.Generic.IList{``0},System.Collections.Generic.IList{``2},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Calculates Mahalanobis distance between each (tracker, measurement pair).
member.param:
If true the distance will be compared with gating threshold and if the distance exceeds the distance threshold value will be written.
The gating is obtained as 99 percent probability interval of the Kalman residual covariance.

member.name: T:Accord.Extensions.Statistics.Filters.PerspectiveProjection2DModel
member.summary:
Perspective projection model for 2D case. Model is constructed as following: p(i) = (f * D) / (f * D + v(k-1) * d(k-1) * dt) * p(k-1) d(k) = (f * D) / (f * D + v(k-1) * d(k-1) * dt) * d(k-1) v(k) - user defined (constant or updated by constant acceleration model)
where variables are: f - focal length D - object width in real word d - object width in an image

member.name: F:Accord.Extensions.Statistics.Filters.PerspectiveProjection2DModel.Dimension
member.summary: Gets the dimension of the model.

member.summary: Gets or sets the object position.

member.name: F:Accord.Extensions.Statistics.Filters.PerspectiveProjection2DModel.ImageObjectWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the image object width.

member.name: F:Accord.Extensions.Statistics.Filters.PerspectiveProjection2DModel.Velocity
member.summary: Gets or sets the real world velocity.

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Statistics.Filters.PerspectiveProjection2DModel.Evaluate(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Evaluates the model by using the provided parameters. The velocity value is copied.
member.param: Velocity multiplier which is calculated by using: function.

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Statistics.Filters.PerspectiveProjection2DModel.CalculateVelocityMultiplierConstant(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates velocity multiplier constant.
member.param: Meter to pixel constant (depends on camera sensor).

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Statistics.Filters.PerspectiveProjection2DModel.EstimateTransitionMatrix(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary:
Estimates transition matrix using numeric Jacobian calculation.
If using Kalman, transition matrix must be updated in each step because the model is not linear.

member.summary: Converts the array to the model.

member.name: T:Accord.Extensions.Statistics.Filters.KalmanFilter`2
member.summary:
A Kalman filter is a recursive solution to the general dynamic estimation problem for the important special case of linear system models and Gaussian noise.
The Kalman Filter uses a predictor-corrector structure, in which if a measurement of the system is available at time t, We first call the Predict function, to estimate the state of the system at time t. We then call the Correct function to correct the estimate of state, based on the noisy measurement.

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Statistics.Filters.KalmanFilter`2.#ctor(`0,System.Double[0:,0:],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Func{`0,System.Double[]},System.Func{System.Double[],`0},System.Func{`1,System.Double[]})
member.summary: Creates Kalman filter.
member.param: The best estimate of the initial state. [1 x n] vector. It's dimension is - n.

Initial error for a state: (assumed values – actual values)^2 + the variance of the values.
e.g. if using ConstantAccelerationModel it can be specified as: Matrix.Diagonal(StateVectorDimension, [x, y, vX, vY, aX, aY]);
Dimensionality of the measurement vector - p.
Dimensionality of the control vector - k. If there is no external control put 0.

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Statistics.Filters.KalmanFilter`2.checkPrerequisites
member.summary: Checks pre-conditions: matrix sizes.

member.summary: State.

member.name: P:Accord.Extensions.Statistics.Filters.KalmanFilter`2.State
member.summary: Gets state (x(k)). [1 x n] vector. After obtaining a measurement z(k) predicted state will be corrected. This value is used as an ultimate result.

member.summary:

The matrix along with innovation vector can be used to achieve gating in JPDAF. See: filter.

member.summary: Gets error estimate covariance matrix (P(k)). [n x n] matrix.

member.summary: Estimates the subsequent model state. This function is implementation-dependent.

member.summary:

Selects components from a state vector that are obtained by measurement.

member.name: P:Accord.Extensions.Statistics.Filters.KalmanFilter`2.ProcessNoise
member.summary:
Gets or sets process noise covariance matrix (Q). [n x n] matrix.
Deviation of selected and actual model. e.g. for constant acceleration model it can be defined as: Matrix.Diagonal(StateVectorDimension, [x, y, vX, vY, aX, aY]); where usually (position error) < (velocity error) < (acceleration error).

member.summary:
Calculates Mahalanobis distance and compares distance and gate threshold.
Gate threshold is obtained by calculating the 99 percent interval for the residual covariance.
member.param: The residual from the measurement and the current state.
member.returns: True if the measurement is inside the gating, false otherwise.

member.summary: Calculates entropy from the provided error covariance matrix.

member.summary: Gets the spatial representation of the error covariance.
member.param: Confidence for the Chi-square distribution. H * P * H' has the Chi-square distribution where H is measurement matrix and P is error covariance matrix.
Measurement matrix which selects state position. If null the state measurement matrix will be used.

member.name: T:Accord.Extensions.Statistics.Filters.DiscreteKalmanFilter`2
member.summary:
A Kalman filter is a recursive solution to the general dynamic estimation problem for the important special case of linear system models and Gaussian noise.
The Kalman Filter uses a predictor-corrector structure, in which if a measurement of the system is available at time t, We first call the Predict function, to estimate the state of the system at time t. We then call the Correct function to correct the estimate of state, based on the noisy measurement.
The discrete Kalman filter can process linear models which have Gaussian noise. If the model is not linear then estimate transition matrix (and other parameters if necessary) in each step and update Kalman filter. This "dynamic" version of an Discrete Kalman filter is called Extended Kalman filter and it is used for non-linear models. If the model is highly non-linear an Unscented Kalman filter or particle filtering is used. See: for details.

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Statistics.Filters.DiscreteKalmanFilter`2.#ctor(`0,System.Double[0:,0:],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Func{`0,System.Double[]},System.Func{System.Double[],`0},System.Func{`1,System.Double[]})
member.summary: Creates Discrete Kalman filter.
member.param: The best estimate of the initial state. [n x 1] vector. It's dimension is - n.

Initial error for a state: (assumed values – actual values)^2 + the variance of the values.
e.g. if using ConstantAccelerationModel it can be specified as: Matrix.Diagonal(StateVectorDimension, [x, y, vX, vY, aX, aY]);
Dimensionality of the measurement vector - p.
Dimensionality of the control vector - k. If there is no external control put 0.

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Statistics.Filters.DiscreteKalmanFilter`2.predictInternal(System.Double[])
member.summary:
Estimates the subsequent model state.
x'(k) = A * x(k-1) + B * u(k). P'(k) = A * P(k-1) * At + Q K(k) = P'(k) * Ht * (H * P'(k) * Ht + R)^(-1)

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Statistics.Filters.DiscreteKalmanFilter`2.CorrectInternal(System.Double[])
member.summary:
The function adjusts the stochastic model state on the basis of the given measurement of the model state.
x(k) = x'(k) + K(k) * (z(k) - H * x'(k)) P(k) =(I - K(k) * H) * P'(k)

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Statistics.Filters.DiscreteKalmanFilter`2.Correct(System.Double[])
member.summary: Corrects the state error covariance based on innovation vector and Kalman update.
member.param: The difference between predicted state and measurement.

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Statistics.Filters.DiscreteKalmanFilter`2.Correct(System.Double[],System.Double,System.Double[0:,0:])
member.summary: Corrects the state error covariance based on innovation vector and Kalman update.
member.param: The difference between predicted state and measurement.
Covariance mixture factor. Used in JPDAF. For Kalman filter default value is 0.
The innovation covariance matrix. Used primary by JPDAF.

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Statistics.Filters.ParticleFilter.Resample``1(System.Collections.Generic.IList{``0},System.Int32)
member.summary: Draws particles randomly, clones them and reinitializes their weights.
member.param: The number of particles to draw.

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Statistics.Filters.ParticleFilter.Predict``1(System.Collections.Generic.IList{``0},System.Single)
member.summary:
Predicts particles' state by resampling, applying drift and diffuse.
Resampling is carried out if particles' effective count ratio is less drops bellow the minimum.
member.param:
If calculated effective count ratio is lower than user specified value re-sampling will occur, otherwise not.
The range is [0..1]. If resampling must occur every time put 1.

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Statistics.Filters.ParticleFilter.Predict``1(System.Collections.Generic.IList{``0},System.Single,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Predicts particles' state by resampling, applying drift and diffuse.
Resampling is carried out if particles' effective count ratio is less drops bellow the minimum.
member.param:
If calculated effective count ratio is lower than user specified value re-sampling will occur, otherwise not.
The range is [0..1]. If resampling must occur every time put 1.
The number of particles to draw during resampling.

member.summary: Calculates Renyi's quadratic entropy of a particle set (also used for JPDAF).
member.param: Particle state selector function (e.g. [x, y, vX, vY]).
member.returns: Renyi's quadratic entropy of a particle set.

member.name: T:Accord.Extensions.Statistics.MedianExtensions
member.summary: Contains extensions for median calculation.

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Statistics.MedianExtensions.Median``1(System.Collections.Generic.IList{``0})
member.summary:
Finds median for the provided collection.
The collection will be mutated.

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Statistics.MedianExtensions.MedianBy``2(System.Collections.Generic.IList{``1},System.Func{``1,``0})
member.summary: Find median for the provided collection.
member.returns: Median for the provided collection for the specified key.

member.name: T:Accord.Extensions.Statistics.NthOrderStatisticExtensions
member.summary:
Extensions for NOrderStatistics calculation.
Taken from: Median calculation and modified.

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Statistics.NthOrderStatisticExtensions.partition``1(System.Collections.Generic.IList{``0},System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Random)
member.summary: Partitions the given list around a pivot element such that all elements on left of pivot are less or equal pivot and the ones at the right are greater or equal pivot. This method can be used for sorting, N-order statistics such as as median finding algorithms. Pivot is selected randomly if random number generator is supplied else its selected as last element in the list. Reference: Introduction to Algorithms 3rd Edition, Corman et al, pp 171

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Statistics.NthOrderStatisticExtensions.GetNthSmallest``1(System.Collections.Generic.IList{``0},System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Random)
member.summary:
Returns Nth smallest element from the list.
Note: specified list would be mutated in the process. Reference: Introduction to Algorithms 3rd Edition, Corman et al, pp 216
member.param: Index for the smallest element to return. Here n starts from 0 so that n=0 returns minimum, n=1 returns 2nd smallest element etc.
The starting element for the provided list.
The end element for th provided list.
Random generator for pivot element selection. If supplied pivot element is selected randomly, otherwise it is selected as last element in the list.

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Statistics.NthOrderStatisticExtensions.GetNthSmallest``1(System.Collections.Generic.IList{``0},System.Int32,System.Random)
member.summary:
Returns Nth smallest element from the list.
Note: specified list would be mutated in the process. Reference: Introduction to Algorithms 3rd Edition, Corman et al, pp 216
member.param: Index for the smallest element to return. Here n starts from 0 so that n=0 returns minimum, n=1 returns 2nd smallest element etc.
Random generator for pivot element selection. If supplied pivot element is selected randomly, otherwise it is selected as last element in the list.

member.name: T:Accord.Extensions.Statistics.RunningAverage
member.summary:
Contains methods for running average calculation. Scalar and vectors of type are supported.
Most methods can be used as extensions.

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Statistics.RunningAverage.UpdateAverageIncremental(System.Double,System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Updates running average incrementally.
member.param: Previous average value. The initial value is 0.
Number of samples that are included (with current element). Starting number is 1.

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Statistics.RunningAverage.UpdateAverageDecremental(System.Double,System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Updates running average decrement-ally.
member.param: Post average value. The initial value is the average of the whole collection.
Number of samples that are included (without current element). Starting number is the total number of samples.

Action callback which fires on each element addition-removal.

member.summary: Adds sample to the total variance.
member.param: The samples SSE (unnormalized variance). The initial value is 0.
Sum of samples weights. The initial value is 0.
Samples mean. The initial value is zero.

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Statistics.RunningWeightedVariance.UpdateVarianceDecremental(System.Double@,System.Double@,System.Double@,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Removes the sample impact from the total variance.
member.param: The samples SSE (unnormalized variance). The initial value is the variance multiplied by sum of weights.
Sum of samples weights. The initial value is the sum of weights.
Samples mean. The initial value is the total mean.

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Statistics.RunningWeightedVariance.Variance(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Double},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Double})
member.summary:
Calculates weighted variance of the provided collection. Division is done using total number of samples.
See weighted variance for details.
